listitem.para: Make small commits, as small as reasonable. This makes them easy to review.

Each commit should have a commit message that explains very clearly what the commit sets out to achieve (unless this is clear from the for trivial changes). If there is a bug/issue related to the commit, indicate that in the message.
Do not mix concerns in commits. Have a commit for a single purpose.
Do NOT break builds for any commit. Always test code before commit.

section.title: Branching policy
section.para: The project strongly prefers that active development happen in master branch. For this to work, master must always be stable. This means that master builds and tests pass at all times, but may not be release ready.

emphasis.para: Make sure the bug have not been reported earlier

para.emphasis: Make it easy to reproduce the bug
Do not have development discussions in the bug tracker

section.title: How to fix bugs
section.para: Format commit message according to convention and GitHub will automatically close associated bug and link the commit to the closure.
